value.title: Britain's GCHQ Cyber Spies Embrace the AI Revolution
value.excerpt: Britain's cyber spies at the GCHQ eavesdropping agency say they have fully embraced artificial intelligence (AI) to uncover patterns in vast amounts of global data to counter hostile disinformation and snare child abusers.

value.title: AI researchers detail obstacles to data sharing in Africa
value.excerpt: Coauthors argue that failure to consider ethical concerns associated with obstacles to data sharing in Africa could cause irreparable harm.

value.title: Google Fires Another Top Researcher on Its AI Ethics Team
value.excerpt: Google has fired another top artificial intelligence researcher, Margaret Mitchell, in the latest escalation of internal tensions at the company following December’s controversial ouster of Timnit Gebru,

value.title: Salesforce Research wields AI to study medicine, economics, and speech
value.excerpt: Salesforce Research is involved with a number of different projects, from biomedical AI to debiasing in natural language processing.

value.title: Google sacks founder of its artificial intelligence ethics programme amid 'sexism and discrimination' claims
value.excerpt: Margaret Mitchell has been critical of her former employer, accusing the firm of having a sexism and discrimination problem.

value.title: Google sacks founder of its artificial intelligence ethics programme amid 'smear campaign' claim
value.excerpt: Margaret Mitchell has been critical of her former employer, accusing the firm of having a sexism and discrimination problem.

value.title: Google fires second AI ethics researcher following internal investigation
value.excerpt: Margaret Mitchell was using an automated script to look through her emails for evidence of discrimination against Timnit Gebru.

value.title: Fintech companies must balance the pursuit of profit against ethical data usage
value.excerpt: Big Tech has written the playbook for what not to do with our data, while also laying a framework for how to build exceptional experiences.

value.title: Why developing AI to defeat us may be humanity’s only hope
value.excerpt: One glance at the state of things and it’s evident humanity’s evolved itself into a corner. On the one hand, we’re smart enough to create machines that learn. On the other, people are dying in Texas because elected officials want to keep the government out of Texas.

value.title: Google has a new responsible AI lead
value.excerpt: Google has appointed Dr. Marian Croak to lead its responsible artificial intelligence division within Google Research, Bloomberg reported earlier today. Croak was previously the vice president of engineering at the company.

value.title: IBM’s Arin Bhowmick explains why AI trust is hard to achieve in the enterprise
value.excerpt: IBM's Arin Bhowmick explains why in the absence of explainability, it remains difficult for enterprise organizations to trust AI models.

value.title: How AI could spot your weaknesses and influence your choices
value.excerpt: In experiments, an AI system successfully learned to influence human decisions. That could be useful in behavioral sciences, public policy, and welfare.

value.title: Will Artificial Intelligence Produce Synthetic Sociopaths?
value.excerpt: Some day soon, computers may convincingly mimic human empathy. Will this lead to ethical artificial intelligence, or synthetic sociopathy?

value.title: Thought-detection: AI has infiltrated our last bastion of privacy
value.excerpt: Research from the UK and an update from Elon Musk on human trials at his brain interface company show software is now eating the mind.

value.title: AI Weekly: Techno-utopianism in the workplace and the threat of excessive automation
value.excerpt: Arguments in favor of shared prosperity and in opposition to excessive robots, AI, and automation in the workplace.

value.title: Developing a Turing test for ethical AI
value.excerpt: AI’s Turing test focused on the wizardry needed to trick us into thinking that scarecrows might be flesh-and-blood humans (if we ignore the stray straws bursting out of their britches). However, I agree with the argument recently expressed by Rohit Prasad,

value.title: How one startup is proving that AI can come up with ethical solutions
value.excerpt: Though artificial intelligence has shown to improve efficiency in business and other aspects of our daily lives, there’s certainly no shortage of moral conundrums that arise from its use. value.title: Sony AI's Dr. Peter Stone Named Fellow by the Association for Computing Machinery
value.excerpt: Dr. Peter Stone, Executive Director, Sony AI America Inc., has been named a Fellow by the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM), the premier professional organization in the field of computer science.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence In The Corporate Boardroom
value.excerpt: We live in a new technological era, one where board members have to be prepared for situations where artificial i (AI) affects and maybe even disrupts their deliberations, with regards to both shareholders and stakeholder groups.

value.title: ‘Orwellian’ AI lie detector project challenged in EU court
value.excerpt: A legal challenge was heard today in Europe’s Court of Justice in relation to a controversial EU-funded research project using artificial intelligence for facial ‘lie detection’ with the aim of speeding up immigration checks.

value.title: Google engineers quit after the company fired its star AI ethics researcher
value.excerpt: Two Google engineers have quit over the firing of AI researcher Timnit Gebru, whose exit sparked an internal backlash about ethics and diversity.

value.title: Two Google engineers quit over firing of ethical AI leader Timnit Gebru
value.excerpt: Two Google engineers have quit over the treatment of Timnit Gebru, former co-lead of the ethical AI team. David Baker, an engineering director, said Gebru’s dismissal “extinguished” his desire to remain at the company.
